scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. Following that, during a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You acknowledged Monica's feelings and suggested a pragmatic approach to prioritize work, but the tension remained high. [Bob] then leaned back in his chair, crossing his arms, and said, 'Prioritizing won't change the fact that we’re understaffed and overworked. What’s the point?' You tried to motivate the team by recalling past successes. [Monica] sighed deeply and said, 'I just don't see how working smart will get us through this. What if we miss the deadline? What then?' You emphasized the importance of effort but acknowledged the potential for failure. The team still seems stressed.
scenes.description: [Bob] looks at you intently and says, 'And if all this effort is for nothing, who's going to take responsibility? Are we just setting ourselves up for failure here?' [Monica] looks worried and nods in agreement.

options.text: Bob, I understand your concern. Let's discuss a backup plan just in case we do miss the deadline.
options.analysis: You acknowledged Bob's concerns and suggested a contingency plan, showing high empathy and good emotional perception.

options.text: I hear you, Bob. If we miss the deadline, we will handle it together as a team. For now, let's stay focused on our tasks.
options.analysis: You recognized the potential for failure but emphasized teamwork and focus, demonstrating good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: If we’re going to spend time worrying about failure, we might as well give up now. Let's concentrate on doing our best.
options.analysis: You downplayed the concern about failure, focusing on immediate action, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
